body:
The logging output should stay where it is when manually scrolled away from bottom.
Currently a log output scrolls to the bottom every time a new log output happens.

This makes it impossible to check previous log output while the app is running.

Scrolling to bottom (manually or using a scroll-to-end button) should restore the current behavior.

comment_data.body:
Just a note, this issue can fix after merging this PR: https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/pull/2416

I just double check on master brand and I can't reproduce this issue.
But there is one more issue: the selected log is un-selected after new log output happens.

@zoechi, @pq what do you think about this problem ?
Should we keep the log selection when new log output happens?

Ah, I understood @zoechi  problem.
It seems we have to detect if the log scroll-up => we will disable `auto scroll to end` action.
I created a new PR to fix this problem: https://github.com/flutter/flutter-intellij/pull/2488

My fix don't include that.
But I think for that action -> user just clicks action `auto-scroll to end`.

>  you should detect when scrolled back to the end to re-enable auto scroll to end

=> To fix that, we just need check new scroll value = 100 => we re-enable `auto scroll to end`.

Ah, I will fix that. I tested on Intellij, after user scroll to end -> `auto scroll to end` must re-enable
@quangson91 that sounds great. Thanks a lot!

milestone.description: Issues under consideration for upcoming milestones.
milestone.title: On Deck

title: Don't scroll to bottom when scrolled away from bottom manually
